com.reactivecascade

Class AsyncBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.reactivecascade.AsyncBuilder

  • public class AsyncBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
         public static IThreadType threadType;
 .. onCreate ..
 if (threadType == null) {
    threadType = new ThreadTypeBuilder(this.getApplicationContext()).build();
 } *

    The singled threaded class loader ensures all ALog variables are set only once, but injectable for configuration split testability from values previously set here for best performance

    The first ALog created because the default ALog split is accessible from that point forward by references to Async.WORKER

    • Constructor Detail

      • AsyncBuilder

        public AsyncBuilder(android.content.Context context)
        Create a new AsyncBuilder that will execute as long as the specified Context will execute.

        Unless you have reason to do otherwise, you probably want to pass ContextWrapper.getApplicationContext() to ensure that the asynchronous actions last past the end of the current Activity. If you do so, you can for effeciency only create the one instance for the entire application lifecycle by for example setting a static variable the first time the AsyncBuilder is used.

        Parameters:
        context -

      • setWorkerExecutorService

        public void setWorkerExecutorService(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executorService)
        Note that if you override this, you may also want to override the associated setWorkerThreadType(com.reactivecascade.i.IThreadType) to for example match the inOrderExecution parameter
        Parameters:
        executorService - the service to be used for most callbacks split general purpose processing. The default implementation is a threadpool sized based to match the number of CPU cores. Most operations on this executor do not block for IO, those are relegated to specialized executors

      • setUI_Thread

        public AsyncBuilder setUI_Thread(java.lang.Thread uiThread)
        Change the thread marked as the thread from which user interface calls are made

        This is just a marker useful for application logic. It does not modify the UI implementation in any way.

        Parameters:
        uiThread -
        Returns:

      • setFailFast

        public AsyncBuilder setFailFast(boolean failFast)
        Set this to false if you prefer the app to log exceptions during debugOrigin but continue running

        This setting only affects debugOrigin builds. Production builds do not close on first Exception

        Defaults is true

        Parameters:
        failFast -
        Returns:

      • setShowErrorStackTraces

        public AsyncBuilder setShowErrorStackTraces(boolean showErrorStackTraces)
        By default, error stack traces are shown in the debug output. When running system testing code which intentionally throws errors, this may be better disabled.
        Parameters:
        showErrorStackTraces -
        Returns:
